Package signatures

Class JDigSigVer

  • java.lang.Object
    • signatures.JDigSigVer
  • public class JDigSigVer
extends java.lang.Object
    Class which demonstrates how to create and verify digital signature.
    Author:
    shashank-shark

      • JDigSigVer

        public JDigSigVer()

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        The steps in generating digital signature and verification include:
        1. Generation of DSA KeyPair.
        2. Generate Signature using the DSA keypair that was generated in the above step.
        3. Digitally sign a message.
        4. Verify the signature.
        Parameters:
        args - - command line arguments

      • validateDigitalSignature

        public static boolean validateDigitalSignature​(java.security.PublicKey publicKey,
                                               byte[] message,
                                               byte[] digitalSignature)
        method to check whether the message recieved is the same message that was sent from the sender.
        Parameters:
        publicKey - - public key of the sender
        message - - message recieved
        digitalSignature - - the digital signature of this particular message
        Returns:
        boolean - true on successful signature verification and false on unsuccessful verification verification is not successful

      • signMessageWithSignature

        public static byte[] signMessageWithSignature​(byte[] message,
                                              java.security.Signature signature)
        method to create digital signature of the message.
        Parameters:
        message - - the message that should be digitally signed
        signature - - DSA signature instance.
        Returns:
        byte[] - array stream of digitally signed bytes.

      • getSHA256WithDSASignature

        method to generate Signature instance from the given KeyPair instance.
        Parameters:
        keyPair - - the generated DSA KeyPair.
        Returns:
        Signature - signature instance
